website_summaries.verdict: At a new low price, the Essential Phone offers serious bang-for-the-buck -- but only patient power users should bite.
pros: The stunning Essential Phone PH-1 feels brilliant in the hand and it’s one of the fastest phones we’ve tested
There's no bloatware or unsightly logos, and its premium materials survived a six-foot drop
Compatible with all major US carriers
cons: Even with welcome updates, Essential's camera still isn't competitive
Battery life is merely OK. No photo or video stabilization
Essential’s modular camera is a battery hog

customer_reviews.title: Awful battery life. Good sounds quality.
customer_reviews.text: This phone has got to have the worst battery life of any phone I've ever owned. From day one I have been lucky to get 5 hours out of a charge. Seems like it's always plugged in. However it does have good sound quality, very loud. Love the display. Just wish the battery wasn't so bad. Update. Now the phone will no longer charge properly. Less than 5 months old.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a phone to switch from iOS to Android, and after a ton of research I purchased this phone on Prime Day for $250. At that price this phone is a steal. It's extremely fast, the screen is gorgeous, and the built quality is unmatched in the industry. The camera app is lacking so I installed a gcam port, and now my photos are amazing in any lighting situation. Reception with AT&T has been great, and I have not noticed any difference between my old phone and this one in that respect. If you're on the fence about this phone go ahead and try it out. It really is an amazing piece of tech.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Cote

customer_reviews.title: Poor reception
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone for $225, and I really really wanted to like thus phone. Don't get me wrong, it's solidly built, fast, and does a lot of things well. I have Verizon service in a major city, and the reception was poor. When driving, the bars continually jumped between a half, a quarter, full, and nothing at all. I couldn't hear people on the other end very well, and a couple of calls dropped. When I swapped out the sim card to my old phone, I was told I sounded much clearer. So back it went after about 10 days of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect daily driver
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant phone at this price point. Pros: 1.Computing performance is solid 2.Screen resolution and color reproduction is descent 3.Worldwide connectivity (Cellular and WiFi) 4.Strong GPS 5.Ceramic is very smooth Cons 1.Pathetic battery 2.Horrid camera (front and rear) 3.Bad microphones 4.Low quality speaker (ear and loud) 5.very fragile front and rear even from 3 FT drops 6.Spare parts are non existent ***Verdict DO not BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Numair Ali Aidroos

customer_reviews.title: Pass. Trust me if on T-Mobile for sure.
customer_reviews.text: Phone is built probably better than anything ever placed in my hand as a smartphone. Everything else.... Reception was horrible on T-Mobile. Dropped signal. All. The. Time. Dropped WiFi. All. The. Time. Buggy UI although essentially stock. Dialer crashed all the time. People would call and couldn't answer. Wouldn't even pop up. Would just ring and vibrate indicating someone is trying. Would reboot and be fixed. Avoid this phone IMO, even with a low price.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Gerardi

customer_reviews.title: getting better all the time
customer_reviews.text: the good: very fast in normal function and great battery life after pie update. also amazing we already go the pie update! 128g is enough space to make me not miss expandable memory. The meh: some software features(like setting wallpapers, ringtones etc.) take a step or two more than on other phones, very hefty for such a small phone thanks to the ceramic and titanium parts, The bad: i am missing the headphone jack, on board camera app has no manual features
customer_reviews.author: Fibinaci

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Phone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this last about a year ago for a sale price of about $400 shipped. By far the best phone at that price point. I was a die-hard Samsung user after switching from iPhone, but the PH1 has been such a fantastic experience. This is a stock android phone and gets the latest and greatest updates long before Samsung or other third-party manufacturers push out their updates. I have never had a problem with this phone. Battery life is great, Screen to body ration is great, and the little notch/punch for the camera is super small. Would definitely recommend, if you can find one.
customer_reviews.author: David F.

customer_reviews.title: SOOOO much better then my Moto 5g+
customer_reviews.text: This is like a night and day difference. With my old phone everything would take a second to load and it was pretty choppy as far as running the os was concerned. This phone does it all now. I have no lag, video plays beautifully. Sound is fine with the dongle when running on some headphones. Need to find a dac for it however but that is a story for another time. Games run fine. This thing has all the specs of a flag ship with a bargain price. I got this for 200 so its definitely a steal for me at least.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kerber

customer_reviews.title: The perfect phone
customer_reviews.text: This phone was an instant classic for me. Everything about it screams quality. I've never had a phone feel like it when it's in your hand. Everyone says that it really heavy, which I love and consider it a good quality in a smartphone. Camera is good, side load the Google cam app and it's even better. This is a classic and after a year it still performs flawlessly. Not one issue. It handles everything I can throw at it. The lack of logo and any bloatware makes it so much better. This phone started so many innovations that are copied by all the phones now. Battery life good as well and charges fully in the blink of an eye.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Picked one up impulsively for $250 on Prime Day. ...
customer_reviews.text: Picked one up impulsively for $250 on Prime Day. An absolute no-brainer at that price. Had bought one earlier this year as a gift for my sister, and she's not had any trouble with it. The updates are quick and regular (although that might change based on where Essential is headed as a company), the hardware and build quality is exceptional, camera is decent (after multiple updates). Make sure you install all updates after initial setup. All in all, a solid everyday phone.
customer_reviews.author: Saksham Sabharwal

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: In my first login I got update to Android Pie, all update was downloaded successfully and it restarted automatically then it stuck at update. I put my mobile on for whole day but never success and then I can't boot up . So finally I need to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Bibek

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware with unfinshed software experience
customer_reviews.text: The phone build quality is really solid and I really like the design and the form factor. I bought this phone on a very good deal. I was using galaxy note 8 and wanted to try stock experience. However, upon using this device for a couple of days, I had to go back to my galaxy due to following reasons: - sometimes phone wouldn't detect my sim card - wifi would automatically turn on and off - lots and lots of bugs. I was runing the latest software version. Tried factory resetting but problems still persisted. Bottom line, I really wanted to like this phone but couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: pet_kharab

customer_reviews.title: Great phone does everything I needed to do
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone picture quality sound quality everything is top notch if I have one gripe about this phone and it's not really essential fault but it's the lack of quality aftermarket screen protectors and cases it's really a chore to find a good quality screen protector or case I've never been the type to go without some sort of protection for my cell phone whether it's an LG HTC or Samsung if you're going to pay that much for a device you want to protect it so other than that the phone itself is great the abundance of mediocre aftermarket accessories is less than stellar
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Crackling audio and weak signal strength
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone in August and gotta say it definitely has nice build quality and gets updated very fast, but it does have some quirks. While the camera is alright, it definitely lacks in the wireless signal department with reception being poor. While playing audio files, most notably Whatsapp voicenotes, there is a crackling sound which is very bothersome. Essential knows about this problem as it has been reported by many, but has yet to fix it, nor will they replace your phone because of it. That being said, I would not recommend this phone until these issues are addressed.
customer_reviews.author: Herring

customer_reviews.title: Great phone
customer_reviews.text: My experience having only had the phone for a few weeks has been great and undoubtedly the experience the company would've wanted when they initially released the phone. Everything runs smoothly. Updates without issues including Android P same day it was released to the pixels. Online reviews from cnet etc probably originally had it accurate, however after all the patches the company has done that I downloaded once I activated my phone... I have no complaints or glitches to report. Hopefully the company and perhaps investors see the end product now and continue on with their mission of quality product (s).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best phone I have used
customer_reviews.text: Despite what some reviews may say this is an amazing phone. Out of the box it is clean from all the bloat of provider apps. It still runs well and I haven't seen any decrease in battery life. Plenty of space for videos, pictures and music. Has an amazing display.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Turned it on, logged into my Google account, a few auto updates, turned off, then DEAD
customer_reviews.text: I returned this dead phone for a replacement after a few terrible hours of ownership. I tried to revive it as per support on the official company website. Nothing. Giving this phone one more try and will revise my one star rating to reflect as such. But honestly I am thinking I just move on and get something else. Buyer beware!!! I do not recommend purchasing this phone from any 3rd party because it is highly likely you will be returning this phone for a replacement or refund. Good luck with a 'replacement or refund' with 3rd party sellers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Android phone under $400
customer_reviews.text: Primarily use iPhone X on AT&T. This is replacing a 5s I was using on Mint SIM (t-mobile). Had no issues so far, phone works well, connections are fine, WiFi calling works, updates are consistently fast, security updates a day or two after released. I do travel extensively, like to have phones on two networks, and one unlocked for international SIM both loaded with my data, cloud access, etc. and its easy enough to setup this phone as an iOS user. Not unfamiliar with Android as previously I had a Nexus 5x on GoogleFi. I've not experienced any of the reported issues. For me this is a good value based on spec's, features, service.
customer_reviews.author: William Flynn

customer_reviews.title: My girlfriend breaks phones, yet this One seems to last.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this phone for my girlfriend who seems to have "phone issues" quite regularly and yet she has had minimal phone issues. I'm actually envious of her ph1, which I bought for around $350. Photo quality is excellent, processing speed is excellent and no extra bloatware to bog it down. I have an LG Stylo 4, which is nothing special, her phone is twice the processing speed, better color clarity, and altogether just makes me feel like I have a 2000's model phone.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: No bloat-ware
customer_reviews.text: Found this phone on sale to replace my ancient LG G2. Near stock Android, and great update policy as a result. Already on Android O, and looks to be getting P soon after it is released. Five star so far. edit: Updated to Android Pie on the first day. First ever non-pixel device to get release-day update to a new Android version. Had to wait months for my LG G2, until they stopped updating it entierly. I hope they keep it up. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Halo grey essential phone from Amazon and it's awesome. The entire phone feels solid being made from quality materials. The back, on this color, is a matte finish that does not show fingerprints. The screen is larger than my daughter's iPhone 7 plus but smaller overall. The camera seems to be an issue for some people but it works fine for me. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. It received android 10 right away.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great phone. Essential has really supported the device. Camera is ok. Get the google pixel apk if you want a big jump in picture quailty. Other wise the phone really reminds me of an iphone 5. Its heavy. Feels quality and works great. One complaint is the screen. For some reason the screen is great looking but its just not as smooth as other phones. When scrolling up and down on a web page its just not as buttery as it should be. Still this phone is really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Luke gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Horror Story
customer_reviews.text: Bought the phone for less than 3 months. Suddenly the phone screen went bad, as shown in the picture: the display goes dark with color stripes only. Touch screen is totally non responsive, the phone is basically useless. Can't get in, can't make or receive a call, can't even turn the phone off. Nobody died, but I just lost all my person data and the phone.
customer_reviews.author: Winston

customer_reviews.title: Phone is a waste of money and has definite problems.
customer_reviews.text: I got this phone and it was okay but it has a problem of dimming intermittently for no reason. Also, my picture screen started having these pink lines in it and they are considering refunding through the back front glass everything is perfect. I hate this. I am a 52-year-old woman who depends on her phone for safety security and communication because I am disabled. Do not buy this phone. I am on a limited income and splurged. DOn't! You may contact me for more details. Not negative, just honest...
customer_reviews.author: mime

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone.. High quality...Great price..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in August 2018 prime sale. Great quality, great value for your money. One of the most underrated phone. Updates and softwares are pure Android. Works every where while we are traveling.. .China.., Japan, Korea, and Europe. Camera is good. It's not as good as $1000 phones...but I am not complaining since this is a $300 purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DavidlyYeti575

customer_reviews.title: Monthly updates are the best!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the Prime day sale for $250 and it was by far the best money I have spent on a phone! I get monthly updates, I am already running Android Pie, Google camera with night site is fantastic and even the stock Essential phone app has been improved to the point it takes very good photos also! I can't wait until Android Q is released to see what it brings to this phone! Note: this phone is now discontinued so you will have to look around to see if you can still snatch one up, but if you can I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: SirDigitalKnight

customer_reviews.title: Best phone for the money
customer_reviews.text: I've always owned top end phones. I went from a galaxy note 8 to this phone, and I don't regret it one bit. The quality on this phone is great. Screen is visible in any light, camera is much better than other phones at the price bracket, and this is by far the loudest speaker I've ever had on a phone. Also bought the 360 camera, which does bog the phone down when it first starts running, but once it gets going it stays quite smooth.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Tiny screen, poor touch recognition
customer_reviews.text: I can't browse the web or do online shopping with this phone. The screen is too small and/or the resolution too poor. Also, do not try to use this phone without a cover. You'll lose it or drop it, and just like every phone ever made, the screen will eventually shatter. A friend raved so much about this, I bought one to see what the fuss was about. I learned what the fuss was about. This is his first non-iPhone. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Shooter McGavin

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this phone on Prime Day, has turned out to be a fantastic purchase. Even at the current non Prime Day price of almost $400, I think I still would have been happy. The quality of the phone is outstanding, great battery life, and quick updates. Received Android P on day one. Had always been a Nexus user, but had to step away when Google went premium with their Pixel line. So its nice to get a great phone, with vanilla android and a great price again.
customer_reviews.author: mumblingmitch

customer_reviews.title: Good value priced phone but missing some features compared to samsung
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper by a couple hundred than an iPhone or Samsung so overall it's a good idea to get it if you want to be responsible with your spending. But do note that some comfort features and ease of use features and just straight up fun / silly features are missing. And be prepared for some apps to not work as well / update as well with the PH-1 as compared to a Samsung. If you're tech savvy you can mostly get around this but for a normal phone user out there who isn't very technical, these issue may ruin your experience and you'll wish you paid the extra $300 for the top end Samsung or iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Best phone I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best phone I've ever had, and that includes iPhones, Samsung and other major brands I am comparing to. I read and reread reviews on Amazon and other tech sites, and was apprehensive about the software bugs, but can honestly say I haven't had anything but a clean, fast, efficient interface in the few weeks since opening the box and powering up. The camera was a particular point of concern and this too is working perfectly with superb photos and video quality (comparing to an iPhone 7+ previously being used with extensive Portrait mode). I would buy this again in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price for the product but some buzzing on WhatsApp audios.
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price but still needs to improve software. Overall works great but randomly gets some buzzing on the WhatsApp audios. Not sure if it is Essential's software (not the hardware since other apps audios worked just fine) or something induced by Android. Amazon provided a replacement and same issue remained. Overall this is a great phone for the price, fast, great resolution and performance. If you are looking for an Android alternative below $500 this is probably one of the best options.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone
customer_reviews.text: I got this on Amazon Prime day for $250. Amazing price and phone. It took some time to process all the updates but after that phone was great. Also got Android 9 on same day as Google phones! It is smooth and has very good battery life. I used it up to 2 days without a charge!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: A great phone essential
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it now for almost two years. The built quality is top notch. The display is bright and responsive. It is a great product to have. The only thing bad with this phone is the camera but if you know how to use Google cam then you can minimize that to a great extent. I am loving it and it is still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: Syeed E.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is great. The matte gray back doesn't collect any fingerprints (unlike the glossy black version), and looks great. Coming from a Galaxy S7 edge, the screen feels a bit more crisp. The best part about this phone over competitors though is the lack of bloatware / unwanted apps such as carrier apps or things like Samsung Pay, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Medica

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for low price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for my daughter recently and its really awesome. I was really tempted to swap my iPhone 7 for this phone. The screen is bigger, the resolution is extraordinary and it contains so many features. The edge to edge bezel is kind of cool while watching videos, playing games, etc... The braided charging & other cables are nice and the titanium, ceramic & Gorilla Glass 5 makes this phone even nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Shanmugam

customer_reviews.title: Why did I buy this?
customer_reviews.text: Wow this phone is the biggest disappointment I've ever had. First off, the camera is bad. I bought this phone July 2018 and now it just broke last night (March 2019) from being out in the cold... Sitting around a bonfire with %15 battery life and then it turned off. Go inside to charge it, wait till it's at %100 and turn it on to a distorted screen... Tried hard resetting it to another distorted screen. Now everything I had on that phone is gone. Biggest disappointment EVER, do not buy this phone.... do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Haleigh Osler

customer_reviews.title: perfect for an essential/basic phone
customer_reviews.text: Speaker sound quality is just so-so. Camera picture quality is just okay (the new camera software or the google camera port help). Otherwise this phone pretty much rocks. Only unexpected issue is that I cannot connect it though Bluetooth to my Denon receiver, but somehow guessing that's the receiver's issue. (It works fine with all my other Bluetooth speakers.)
customer_reviews.author: sweetmustard

customer_reviews.title: Decent value for money at the low 200 range.
customer_reviews.text: Beautifully designed exterior and still one of the best implementations of the notch. Cameras leave a lot to be desired even when using Gcam (which does help). Premium exterior design, but terrible haptic feedback and sound makes it feel budget despite its good looks. Stock Android to a fault makes it feel boring and uninspired at times. Great value though considering the hardware, if you can get it in the low 200 range.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Fontanez

customer_reviews.title: 128GB, Android 9.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for work & personal, had Nexus 6P, battery dying. $300.00 got me 128GB internal, no sd expansion. Phone is near bezel-less, pure Android. Slight notch. Great wireless, all bells and whistles. Was thinking about pixel3, OnePlus 6T, could not wait. Price should have been more. Upgraded to Android 9(Pie). Yes, that is available on this phone. Also, did I mention, 128 GB storage? For $300.00. should last you at least 2 years. Buy one now.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Gopher

customer_reviews.title: Great build, Android Pie fantastic, cell quality as bad as can be
customer_reviews.text: Great hardware and Android Pie 9.0 but the cell signal is a deal breaker. I'm on AT&T and had a Moto G5 Plus and the Essential Phone was so so much worse picking up cell service
customer_reviews.author: mattpex

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: First day with it and I already love that it has so much storage. Will update later Update 7.14.18 Still tons of storage left and still runs amazingly good. Battery still lasts all day if I'm not gaming on it and just use it for social media.
customer_reviews.author: Jay O.

customer_reviews.title: Poor development
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected and I researched it. Generally unable to get a good cell signal. Reported it to Essential and they gave me the whole rest everything to default. The phone is new and I did and still bad. to adjust the ring volume you have to go into sounds to adjust the volume only adjust the media. If you accidentally cover the fingerprint scanner the screen drops down and can't find a way to stop it. Generally a poor phone I was hope would work to Llow a pure Andriod but will never buy another. BTW I work in IT and we manage over 500 phones
customer_reviews.author: connie Langley

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money, if you needed one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for myself but had a difficult time justifying the expense because I also own an LG V30. I ended up selling it to my sister so she could replace the LG G2 I sold her years ago. She's quite satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Heinrich

customer_reviews.title: I'm such a fan of this phone
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. I love, love, love the 128 gb, I love the no-bloatware. I love knowing I'll get the android updates timely. I love the design with the ceramic back. I thought I would hate the boxiness of the phone but no, I love the shape too. Not many phone cases to choose from, but I got a couple I like. I bought it new, not refurbished, and my phone has worked perfectly. Responsive to the touchscreen and no lock ups. If Essential keeps making phones like this, I'm a fan for the duration.
customer_reviews.author: Rosco P Coltrane

customer_reviews.title: OF course this phone is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Every time I find something Wonderful the company that makes it Goes Away. This phone is Wonderful. It made my Sprint rep Squeal in Fright when I informed them I could go to Any us carrier with My phone. Got my bill reduced by 15 dollars a month too. Don't Buy them though! I need at least three more to last my lifetime and they aren't making any more of them.
customer_reviews.author: Arcanis Gix

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works great for the price. Was using the One Plus 3 but this phone is faster. Only issue is the fingerprint censor not working as fast as when I first got it. Called support and they suggested to do a factory reset. Not going to happen. I will work around this problem.
customer_reviews.author: mbabich

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and durability
customer_reviews.text: Loving this device. Snappy performance and the durability is amazing. (I wish it were waterproof though.) I wasn't sure about the durability until today when the phone fell out of my jacket pocket onto the ground twice. First time, two loose dogs accosted me and my dog and I had to fend them off while restraining my own. Phone fell during the fracas. Half an hour later, while buying a cup of coffee, I realized my dog had escaped from her harness. I rushed out to rescue her. While scooping her up, the phone fell again. Only damage, a couple very small nicks on the back at the edge. No noticeable damage to the screen. Incredible!
customer_reviews.author: Charles Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this phone. The build quality is amazing. The size is perfect. My first one worked well but it died...completely. Amazon was great and sent me a replacement. Unfortunately, that phone had pretty serious problems with reception. Be warned, this phone does not have strong signal quality. On my second phone, the GPS struggled to connect to the network. I have AT&T and there were time I wouldn't have a GPS signal. I have a second phone, an iPhone 8+ and it has none of these problems. Sadly, I have requested a refund and will try another brand all together.
customer_reviews.author: mrmcam

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Mediocre back cam
customer_reviews.text: This phone is all you need in a smart phone. Screen is incredible, battery life and charging is best on the market. Durability is incredible. The only thing it lacks in quality is the camera. Rear camera mainly. Front facing cam is better quality than some iPhones. Rear camera just doesn't deliver the crispness that other smart phone cameras on the market deliver. If essential releases a 2nd phone with an exceptional camera they would be a major player in the smart phone game.
customer_reviews.author: Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't deserve the bad rap it gets.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the essential phone. Had this phone for a few months now and it has received several updates and gets a little better as it goes along. Worth the money. All day battery, snappy performance and a very decent display. Just wish it was a little bigger. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Emac

customer_reviews.title: this is not as seamless as a true vanilla pixel phone. would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: I've used pure vanilla google phones on a straight talk sim card for about 7 years. Both Motorola, LG. Text messaging does not work, on this phone. Random messages are missing, I've spend a lot of time trying to fix this to no avail. its frustrating to say the least. looks like we're buying a new phone...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: All what they said good about the phone tend to be true. What I don't like after a month of use: -Screen didn't resist some force applied against a wood edge (sleeping accident), it's still complete and survived with just 2 tiny but thick scratches though. -Sound is terrible at low volume even when using headphones -Cameras are fast but anything else about them are not good enough -bad connectivity with the 360 camera (actually mine cannot connect yet) That's what I consider are the most annoying of all the cons.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Ernesto Ojeda Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Too Many Applications Will Hang
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this phone for over 3 months now. In the beginning this worked and looked fine... However as the days passed by, my Google Chrome application keeps hanging (I only use this for minimal browsing). Never browse any sites that bring me viruses etc. Once in a while calls get dropped. Screen gets unresponsive and I had to lock it and unlock it for it to be responsive again. Other application hangs are not uncommon. Overall for the price this phone should have gone through a better QA and more reliable. I used Moto-X in past and I would definitely recommend Moto over this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Raghu Cherukuru

customer_reviews.title: Best Phone with small body!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best phone i ever got and i have lot of phones, the body aspect radio its so good on the hand, small phone with bigger screen! battery life its the best with that screen and body! love the too fast updates factor, every 1 on the month get the updates and the phone gonna get android 10!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Mora R

customer_reviews.title: This Phone is Standard Perfection.
customer_reviews.text: No need for a lengthy review. This phone is Perfection . Unfortunately camera software is pure trash.. Also, 9 months in I dropped the phone and the top right display under the screen broke and blacked out. Ill miss this phone. 😭😭😭😭
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best budget phone for 2018
customer_reviews.text: Fairly new processor and updates sometimes comes before Google gets theirs. Battery with Pie is excellent and I come home me with 60% from work. First with to coveted notch, if it matters. Titanium and ceramic materials, but heavy. Can be sliperry, so I added a textured back skin.
customer_reviews.author: Megatron Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Smooth, and Great Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Its a great phone. Not sure why this phone gets a bad rap. I'm on ATT and it gets a great signal. Its fast,smooth, great battery life, and gets updates the same day as Google's pixel line. Absolutely no complaints. Wish I would have jumped on the phone sooner.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I like all this phone because my son got one for him last year and last month I bought one for me when they were in offer special. It's better than Apple phone .. I'm happy with this phone
customer_reviews.author: Melyce

customer_reviews.title: This Phone is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Why pay more for a phone? This phone is an excellent phone, I've been using for nearly a year at the time I'm writing this and I don't have any issues with quality built, screen quality or anything else related to the built of the phone. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy Zabal

customer_reviews.title: great phone
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for about 6 months and I love it. Great battery life, excellent camera, beautiful display, and good call quality. Essential will be my first choice for my next phone - if they ever release one!
customer_reviews.author: Waynoworld

customer_reviews.title: Really good phone at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great phone with a great price. Ignore the old bad reviews, Essential has been updating this phone constantly since release and has resolved the issues. Some still complain about the camera but they have really made vast improvements over the past year. Security updates are superb, in some cases beating the Pixels! There is an option to upload Android P beta now and Project Treble is supported on this phone. If you are on the fence, just get it and you will have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: David Parker

customer_reviews.title: Give it a try!
customer_reviews.text: Despite early negative reviews, this is a great phone. Should definitely give it a try. Clean software, fast performance, good sound quality, and great camera. If you can get it on sale this phone should be considered. The only drawback for me is that I wanted a phone with a bigger screen. Phones nowadays are getting bigger and I jumped on the bandwagon.
customer_reviews.author: TripOG

customer_reviews.title: Dropped it in a gallon of paint and it still works
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for about a year with no case for most of that time. It has a few minor scratches, but it looks great when you consider how many times I've dropped it. Speaking of which, I recently dropped it into a gallon of paint and was able to wipe it off and continue to using it. When I say I dropped it, I mean it sank to the bottom of the gallon with no cover. I used a dry toothbrush to scrub out the charging port and speaker. The speaker sounds a bit crackly but otherwise I don't see any difference.
customer_reviews.author: bob dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Can no longer recommend this phone.  No support.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great phone until the most recent system update. Now I have flaky Bluetooth and mobile data issues where the settings just randomly turn off. Company is refusing to honor their warranty. I can no longer recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Guru

customer_reviews.title: I would never purchase this brand ever again
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing cell phones for over 30 years I bought this cellphone as a retirement gift to myself with the most I had ever paid for a cell phone this phone was a very big disappointment I thought overtime with software updates with improved but this never happened the phone drops calls the phone has very poor connection to Wi-Fi by the phone will drop a Bluetooth connection with the phone only one to two feet from the Bluetooth this phone was a big disappointment
customer_reviews.author: ronnie mcneal

customer_reviews.title: Best phone in my household, of all of them... Apple or Android!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone! No bloatware from the carrier, Android updates as released, things aren't running in the background you didn't even know we're on the phone!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wyman

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Aviod.
customer_reviews.text: Had around 6 months now. Screen is unresponsive at times and phone shuts down randomly. Will have to find a replacement soon. Battery barely gets though the day. I need my phone like alot of people for work and this phone simply is more useful as a paperweight. Update August 2019. This phone is now becoming unusable. The keyboard randomly disappears and it is incredibly slow. How can you sell a phone this bad!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon221

customer_reviews.title: It’s got bang
customer_reviews.text: This is about as stock as Android gets. It seems fast, charging was very fast, and no lag. I’ll update as I go, but I bought mine for $200. At that price, you won’t find a better phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrold

customer_reviews.title: distinct. powerful. sharp
customer_reviews.text: Bought the ph-1 for prime day but definitely would have paid more for this device. Glad to have the chance to have such a premium phone. The essential is solid in hardware and software. The camera has a lot of potential and even as it is the quality is very good. Hopefully essential will keep improving. Fast response, pure Android experience, great built quality. 360 camera is a must have. Hope to see more from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Spare phone that became my main phone
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this phone with the idea that this was going to be my backup. I have been an Android enthusiast and realized that this phone was getting regular updates faster than my Samsung phone. At the end I ended up making this my main device. There are plenty of reviews out there and this is more so to let you know that I dont regret my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Good phone
customer_reviews.text: Phone is great. Wish reception was little better not as good as my Samsung S7. Picture and camera are very good. Downside of phone are there are no high end cases available for it. The Incipio was best come I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mukai

customer_reviews.title: The best phone I ever purchased!
customer_reviews.text: This phone is the best I have ever purchased. It runs the latest version of Android smoothly. It runs multiple hi resolution games well. The screen is amazing. The build quality is nice as well. It's a nice phone, and with the $300-$400 price tag, it wins in the quality and affordability category for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Warkoski

customer_reviews.title: Smh
customer_reviews.text: Brought less than a year ago now screen is broken. Not a quality product
customer_reviews.author: Jaylen Young

customer_reviews.title: Best value for this class of phones
customer_reviews.text: I've had this phone for about fouronths now and I'm not disappointed. YouTube disparages this phone to an extreme. I've had no problems with. One thing that I've noticed is that while I'm playing games it gets pretty darn warm. But the overall performance is quick and sleek
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Battery sucks
customer_reviews.text: The phone seemed perfect for a bit, except the battery was kinda meh. Over time, the battery started discharging faster. But there's a massive problem. The battery discharges fine when the screen is on. It dies faster when the phone is in sleep mode. I can go from using the phone for 4 hours straight and have 30 percent left, to setting it down for ten minutes and it will have died in that time.
customer_reviews.author: Hellucinating Hipponax

customer_reviews.title: Fast and lighweight
customer_reviews.text: Just to keep it brief. I really love this phone, it's pure stock android without any bloatware. Now while it does not have expandable memory, the 128 Gigs more than makes up for it. The only real downside is that there is no Headphone Jack, so close to being perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best phone I ever had!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone. The build quality is off the charts. It blows everything out of the waters. The battery life is great. The speakers is fantastic. I will definitely buy another Essential product because of this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Faaaz

customer_reviews.title: The phone has a great design and is weightier than the iPhone
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this for a couple days now and its my first Android phone. I dropped in my Verizon SIM from my iPhone 6S and it worked right away, no issues. The only issue I had was setting up mobile payments. The sensor in the phone is somewhere near the bottom of the phone instead of the top (where the iPhone sensor is) and the phone has to be unlocked to process the payment, both of which aren't quite ideal. The phone has a great design and is weightier than the iPhone, which I like, but may not be ideal for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Todd D Swinehart

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Got a great deal at Amazon day. The fit and finish is top notch. Get a lot of compliments from people on the quality of the material and the edge to edge display. Only thing missing is the headphone jack
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Dope phone
customer_reviews.text: They did good. It's unpretentious, professional, a little off the beaten track, and it takes instruction well. I aspire to be this phone.
customer_reviews.author: ElseRavenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Software update bricks phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone works great but will cost you in the long run. After a year the software updates bricked my phone and render it useless along with everything on it. I'm stunned.
customer_reviews.author: David Meis

customer_reviews.title: SOLID PIECE OF EQUIPMENT
customer_reviews.text: This thing feels great in my hand, runs smoothly, charges fast. Of course everyone has different demands and priorities, but if this thing holds up it may just be the best one I've owned. Fingerprint sensor is awesome, camera is better than expected, Android 9 running without a hitch.
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Works but has a few issues. Battery is lacking, the customer service is awful.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone over six months ago and have had nothing but issues with the phone lasting less than a day. I use it minimally and still can't get it to last past 5pm. The charger sometimes works sometimes doesn't. The phone overall has few glitches but if it's endlessly dead and not functional. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Lurye

customer_reviews.title: Keep working on it
customer_reviews.text: Features are really good. I enjoyed the fingerprint unlock especially. Unfortunately, I've had to return 2 devices because they're locked up, frozen. I think it's just bugs in a new device. I hope the company is able to work then out.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi M Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended device
customer_reviews.text: work with all four major US carriers and some others internationally,BUT it will be discontinued and unsupported by Essential themselves. The company is closing shop.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: I love the zero bezels on this bad boy
customer_reviews.text: Very sleek phone! I love the zero bezels on this bad boy. Phone is snappy and fast. Love the pure android. I didn't realize how much I'd like pure android until I had it. Zero bloat ware. Oreo 8.1 update fixes all the issues in the initial negative reviews of the phone in October. Case selection is a little lacking though, but to be expected with a new entry into the market. Camera is good but not the best. At this price point this phone is an absolute beast. Phone is heavy and durable. Nice break from cheap plastic (looking at you samsung).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This phone, especially at this price tag is just insane.
customer_reviews.text: This phone feels super premium, its fast, minimalistic, beautiful and built to last. I'm a happy camper. The camera camera quality is over-exaggerated. Its fine for me and i come from a lg G4 which has a great camera on. Low light is only part is struggles a bit with but most phones do. If you are buying this phone wait for it to drop to $449 at least. It is moving between $499 and $449 on a weekly basis. Its a absolute steal at $449.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: I like the phone itself but this cosmetic defect makes it ...
customer_reviews.text: The halo gray version seems to have these strange permanent smudges around the fingerprint scanner, camera and the edges of the phone. They just don't come off and I have no idea what they are. I like the phone itself but this cosmetic defect makes it lose 1 and a half stars.
customer_reviews.author: Zawaad M.

customer_reviews.title: A solid phone with some details.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is AMAZING as a piece of hardware, the quality of its materials coupled with a gorgeous design has been the best aspect of the phone so far. The software is also a strong point, with a fluent experience as expected with stock Android and a snapdragon 835; however I seem to have a problem with the audio drivers that keep bugging my sound and introducing static on some apps (only when using the speaker though) but it is not that annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Speaker stopped working within 60 days
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone after owning a Galaxy. It doesn't even compare. But I was willing to work through it until I got my money's worth. But that didn't happen because within 60 days, the speaker stopped functioning. I purchased a new phone and less than 2 months later I can barely hear people on the phone. Too late for a return. I'm trying to work through the warranty now but that has become ridiculously confusing and laborious. Ugh! I will update once I find out how the warranty works.
customer_reviews.author: blessedkeri

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Great phone, great looks, great feel! Worth every penny. Hope the other colors (green and other shade of grey) would be available for sale, simply amazing phone.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Phone I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: This phone is really amazing, the camera quality is insane and on par with the lastest iphones out. The 128gb storage allowed me to save all my moments with my family and my significant other. The sound is pretty good but its a washed out and sounds decent on higher volumes.
customer_reviews.author: Toby D.

customer_reviews.title: Looks beautiful, works great.
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the phone. I would say be careful with it though, it's very sleek, so will easily slip in your hands... I don't like using a case so that's a concern for me. Also, if you keep your phone in your pocket, without a case, be sure to keep other things away from it as the ceramic can be scratched by other metallic objects. Probably seems like an obvious thing but I wasn't really thinking about it and put a few small scratches on it. Other than that, no complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic buy.
customer_reviews.text: High quality and performance. Like just about everything about it. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Warren A. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Awesome design (better than any current cel phone) with it's titanium and ceramic materials and nearly full edge-to-edge display. It just needs wireless charging and OLED display. Then it'd be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Smooth

customer_reviews.title: For the money I paid for this phone wish I had bought two
customer_reviews.text: Never cared for this brand, their ridiculous $700 MSRP was unjustifiable, but when this phone became on sale and was sold for $250 it was a steal! Value for money-wise it's as good as it's going to get, impossible to buy a better phone for that price.
customer_reviews.author: Eyal

customer_reviews.title: Dollar for value, no other phone of its generation competes
customer_reviews.text: Granted, I don't take pictures, so if that's your thing, then the camera quality may disappoint. Other than that though, there's not a single complaint I have about this device. I've had it for around 2 years and its as good now as it was when I first got it.
customer_reviews.author: Tam Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Screen pop out with no reason
customer_reviews.text: I got my phone in March. It is October and The screen just pop out of the frame. Phone has no damage at all. I had all kind of phones before Cheap and expensive ones. It never happened something like this. A big disappointment that a phone of this class can fail on manufacturing like this. I attached pictures of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Cavero

customer_reviews.title: Phone doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Phone lasted for only a year. Would recommend if looking for something temporary.
customer_reviews.author: C

product_meta.title: Essential Phone in Halo Gray – 128 GB Unlocked Titanium and Ceramic phone with Edge-to-Edge Display
product_meta.description:
Founded by the creator of Android, the Essential Phone has all the features you care about most without a bunch of gimmicks. A large, edge-to-edge display, 128GB of storage, all-day battery life, fast charging, and more. It's sophisticated. It's simple. And it's yours.

Ports - 60GHz Wireless, SuperSpeed USB 2x accessory power pins

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 




More screen, less phone The biggest screen-to-body ratio of any phone! With a stunning 5.71-inch edge-to-edge Quad HD Display, you get a large screen in a phone that still fits comfortably in one hand. So you can enjoy more of what’s on your screen without all those intrusive bezels. 

Beauty meets brawn Crafted with space-age strength, titanium, ceramic, and Gorilla Glass 5. Its space-age strength helps withstand your day-to-day. And there's no branding or logos anywhere on the device. So your phone is more of an expression of who you are—because it’s yours. 




For every adventure With a 13MP Dual-Camera and Portrait Mode, your pictures look great. And the Essential 360 Camera is big enough to easily capture everything around you in 4K — but small enough to fit in your pocket. So it can take it with you everywhere.

Store more, worry less PH-1 comes with a whopping 128GB of storage. So you can easily store all your photos, 4K and 360 videos, games, and more without worrying about running out of space—or needing to spend more money on external storage options.

Straight-up Android PH-1 runs pure Android. No unnecessary apps, preloads, or anything that gets in your way of getting the latest Android updates and features. You get a smooth experience that is fast and fluid. 




Revolutionary accessories The Click Connector on Essential Phone makes using accessories easier than ever. They magnetically attach and power up using your PH-1. So you don’t need to charge your accessories to use them. And because the Click Connector will be on future Essential devices, you can use your current accessories with future Essential devices.




About the Startup Describe your product in 3 words.

Freedom is Essential

How did you come up with the idea for this product?

I know people are going to ask me a lot of questions about why I started this company. Why didn’t I just travel the world, ride my motorcycle, tinker with my robots, hang out at my bakery with friends and family. And to be honest I still do ask myself that sometimes…but not too often. So why did I create Essential? Well, my hardware engineers wanted me to talk about how we are bringing real passion and craftsmanship back into this category. My software engineers wanted me to talk about our vision for making all devices, even those we don't make ourselves, play well together. My partners wanted me to talk about how we are using methods that could change how successful technology companies are built forever. And this is all true. But the real reason is because of what happened during a night out with an old friend of mine. As the night went on we inevitably began talking about what we didn't like about the current state of technology. Less and less choice. More and more unnecessary features cluttering our lives. An increasing sea of products that didn't work with one another… And just when I was about to drop another criticism it hit me: I am partly responsible for all of this. For all the good Android has done to help bring technology to nearly everyone it has also helped create this weird new world where people are forced to fight with the very technology that was supposed to simplify their lives. Was this what we had intended? Was this the best we could do? I left that night reflecting deeply on what was great and what was frustrating with the current state of technology today. After another long talk with my friend we decided that I needed to start a new kind of company using 21st century methods to build products for the way people want to live in the 21st century. 

What makes your product special?

This is what we believe: • Devices are your personal property. We won’t force you to have anything on them you don’t want to have. • We will always play well with others. Closed ecosystems are divisive and outdated. • Premium materials and true craftsmanship shouldn’t be just for the few. • Devices shouldn’t become outdated every year. They should evolve with you. • Technology should assist you so that you can get on with enjoying your life. • Simple is always better. 

What has been the best part of your startup experience?

I have used the above principles to inform everything Essential is doing and they have helped me attract some of the best and brightest people from all over the world to join me in bringing this vision to life. We won’t achieve everything we hope on day one, but if you’re one of those people who also thinks it’s time for something new, please have a look at www.essential.com to learn more.
feature_bullets: With a matte finish to both the titanium and ceramic, this Amazon exclusive Essential Phone has a more industrial look while maintaining its elegant design
Stunning edge-to-edge Quad HD display—the largest screen-to-body ratio of any smartphone. So you get a massive screen, but on a phone that still fits comfortably in one hand

13MP Dual RGB + Mono Rear camera with Portrait Mode and 4K video recording . Get more natural looking shots and incredible high-resolution video. Brightness- 500 nits (typical). Contrast Ratio- > 1000:1 (typical). Aspect Ratio- 19:10
Huge 128GB of storage, included. Save all of your photos and videos without worrying about running out of space. Battery: 3040mAh
Never charge your accessories again. With the revolutionary Click Connector, your phone attaches to accessories, magnetically—and even powers them. No cables or adapters needed
Includes Amazon Alexa. Get real-time answers to questions, shop for items on Amazon, control devices around your home, access Alexa skills, and more, all with the sound of your voice
Essential Phone receives rapid security and OS updates and now includes the latest version of Android 9 Pie
Award-winning MQA technology to deliver studio quality music listening on the go
A 3-month TIDAL HiFi subscription for new and existing Essential Phone customers with access to thousands of MQA tracks. Visit essential.com/audio to redeem the Tidal offer
NOTE: Refer the User Manual before use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars852 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Phone, USB Power Adapter, USG C-C Cable, Type C to Phone Jack Connector
